intro: Polemonium kiushianum, commonly known as the Korean Jacob's ladder, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Korea. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing shades of blue to purple. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
